alert.note: Alert for Middle Tanana Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 28 at 11:48PM AKST until December 30 at 6:00AM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM AKST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow occuring. Light freezing rain possible. High winds with blowing snow expected. Travel will be very difficult to impossible. Power lines could be damaged. Total snow accumulations 12 inches are expected. Freezing rain possible from Fairbanks south through Wednesday morning with a light glaze possible. West winds gusting 40 to 50 mph expected through Wednesday afternoon. * WHERE...Middle Tanana Valley. * WHEN...Now through 6 AM Thursday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Heavy snow and a chance of light freezing rain will continue through early Wednesday morning. Several more inches of snow are expected on Thursday. West winds gusting 40 to 50 mph are expected through Wednesday afternoon which will cause blowing snow with brief blizzard conditions. Power lines could be damaged and trees blown over by the strong winds. The strongest winds are expected Wednesday morning. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... A Winter Storm Warning for snow and blowing snow means severe winter weather conditions are occurring. This will make travel very difficult or impossible. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
